description: Borrowed from Latin ērādīcātus, past participle of ērādīcō (“uproot”), from ē- (“out”) + rādīx (“root”). Also see: radish.

verbs.description: eradicate (third-person singular simple present eradicates, present participle eradicating, simple past and past participle eradicated)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To pull up by the roots; to uproot.
(transitive) To destroy completely; to reduce to nothing radically; to put an end to; to extirpate.
